## transducers-stats package

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [bollinger(period, sd)](./transducers-stats.bollinger.md) | Computes Bollinger bands using sliding window.[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bollinger\_Bands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bollinger_Bands)<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period-1</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |

|  [bollinger(period, src)](./transducers-stats.bollinger_2.md) |  |
|  [bollinger(period, sd, src)](./transducers-stats.bollinger_3.md) |  |
|  [donchian(period)](./transducers-stats.donchian.md) | Computes Donchian channel, i.e. min/max values for sliding window.[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donchian\_channel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donchian_channel)<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period-1</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [donchian(period, src)](./transducers-stats.donchian_1.md) |  |
|  [ema(period)](./transducers-stats.ema.md) | [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving\_average\#Exponential\_moving\_average](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving_average#Exponential_moving_average)<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period-1</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [ema(period, src)](./transducers-stats.ema_1.md) |  |
|  [hma(period)](./transducers-stats.hma.md) | [https://www.fidelity.com/learning-center/trading-investing/technical-analysis/technical-indicator-guide/hull-moving-average](https://www.fidelity.com/learning-center/trading-investing/technical-analysis/technical-indicator-guide/hull-moving-average)<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period + floor(sqrt(period)) - 2</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [hma(period, src)](./transducers-stats.hma_1.md) |  |
|  [macd(fast, slow, smooth)](./transducers-stats.macd.md) | Computes the Moving Average Convergence/Divergence (MACD) using given periods.<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>slow + smooth - 2</code> less than the number of processed inputs.[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MACD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MACD) |
|  [macd(src)](./transducers-stats.macd_1.md) |  |
|  [macd(fast, slow, smooth, src)](./transducers-stats.macd_2.md) |  |
|  [momentum(period)](./transducers-stats.momentum.md) | Note: the number of results will be <code>period</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [momentum(period, src)](./transducers-stats.momentum_1.md) |  |
|  [roc(period)](./transducers-stats.roc.md) | Rate of change.[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Momentum\_(technical\_analysis)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Momentum_(technical_analysis))<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period</code> less than the number of processed inputs and no outputs will be produced if there were less than <code>period</code> input values. |
|  [roc(period, src)](./transducers-stats.roc_1.md) |  |
|  [rsi(period)](./transducers-stats.rsi.md) | [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative\_strength\_index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_strength_index)<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [rsi(period, src)](./transducers-stats.rsi_1.md) |  |
|  [sd(period, scale)](./transducers-stats.sd.md) | Moving standard deviation, calculates mean square error to SMA and yields sequence of <code>sqrt(error / period)</code>.[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bollinger\_Bands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bollinger_Bands)<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period-1</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [sd(src)](./transducers-stats.sd_1.md) |  |
|  [sd(period, scale, src)](./transducers-stats.sd_2.md) |  |
|  [sma(period)](./transducers-stats.sma.md) | Like [movingAverage()](./transducers.movingaverage.md)<!-- -->, but using more efficient linked list as sliding window buffer.<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period-1</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [sma(period, src)](./transducers-stats.sma_1.md) |  |
|  [stochastic(periodK, periodD1, periodD2)](./transducers-stats.stochastic.md) | Stochastic oscillator. Yields tuples of <code>[%K, %D1, %D2]</code>, where:<!-- -->- %K = (curr - L5) / (H5 - L5) - %D1 = SMA(%K, periodD1) - %D2 = SMA(%D1, periodD2)[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stochastic\_oscillator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stochastic_oscillator) |
|  [stochastic(src)](./transducers-stats.stochastic_1.md) |  |
|  [stochastic(periodK, periodD1, periodD2, src)](./transducers-stats.stochastic_2.md) |  |
|  [trix(period)](./transducers-stats.trix.md) | [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trix\_(technical\_analysis)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trix_(technical_analysis))<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>3 * (period - 1) + 1</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [trix(period, src)](./transducers-stats.trix_1.md) |  |
|  [wma(weights)](./transducers-stats.wma.md) | [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving\_average\#Weighted\_moving\_average](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moving_average#Weighted_moving_average)<!-- -->Note: the number of results will be <code>period-1</code> less than the number of processed inputs. |
|  [wma(weights, src)](./transducers-stats.wma_1.md) |  |

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [bounds](./transducers-stats.bounds.md) | Computes min / max values of given array. |
|  [dot](./transducers-stats.dot.md) | Computes dot product of 2 arrays. Assumes <code>a</code> and <code>b</code> are equal sized, but only considers length of <code>a</code>. |
|  [mse](./transducers-stats.mse.md) | Computes mean square error of given array. |
